ygData.subject: Re: Barrier Level
ygData.msgSnippet: I just can t wait to hit Lvl 19 I get some more spells and should have enough money for them and still have some left over.  I know I can t wait to hit Lvl 20,
ygData.messageBody:
I just can't wait to hit Lvl 19 I get some more spells and should have
enough money for them and still have some left over. I know I can't wait to
hit Lvl 20, get my last name. I know I heard before when you hit Lvl 20 and
die you lose a bubble of exp, since they fixed it to where when ya die you
don't lose as much exp how much do you lose now on 20 and up?

**************************
Azor
Lvl 16 Human Cleric of the Rathe
**************************

> From: Lanadina the Magician <lanadina@...>
>
>
> Gilead,
>
> Unfortunately, it is true. Level 30 and 35 are barrier levels, meaning,
they
> pack more EXP into each bubble in your exp bar. My poor wizard friend took
> *3 weeks* to get out of that level. I have three more levels to go before
I
> hit that dreaded level....
> Ding! Welcome to level 30, Welcome to hell! <grin>
>
> Lanadina
>
>
> >Is it really true that levels 30, 35, and so on are unusually hard? Has
> >Verant confirmed this, or is it just a subjective impression of players?
> >How
> >fast you level depends a lot on what you are fighting, of course. Unrest
is
> >very good for both xp and loot for levels 16 through 30 or so...which is
> >probably why there were 100 people (count 'em 100) in the zone at one
point
> >last night, and every single room was camped.
> >
> >== Gilead, dwarven cleric of Fennin Ro
